tuv.seg: It is possible to have an ordinary referendum which is one that does not relate to amending Bunreacht na hEireann (the Irish Constitution)
Is gnáth reifreann ceann nach mbaineann le leasú a dhéanamh ar an mBunreacht, cé nach raibh aon reifreann den chineál seo ann fós
Since the foundation of the State however, no ordinary referendum has ever been held
Ó bhunús an Stáit ní raibh aon reifreann den chineál seo ann fós
An ordinary referendum would take place if the Irish President received a joint petition from both houses of the Oireachtas (the Irish Parliament), that is, the Dáil and the Seanad
Dá bhfaigheadh an tUachtarán comhachainí ón Dáil agus ón Seanad d'fhéadfaí gnáth reifreann a bheith ann
The petition would set out that a proposed Bill was of such national importance that the will of the people of Ireland should be found out before it became law
Bheadh sé leagtha síos san achainí go raibh tábhacht mór náisiúnta ag baint le Bille molta nach mór toil mhuintir a fhiosrú romh dlí a dhéanamh den bhille
The joint petition must be passed by the majority of the members of the Seanad and one-third of the members of the Dáil
Ní mór do thromlach na Seanadóirí agus aon trian de na Teachtaí Dála a bheith ar son na hachainí
When the President receives the petition, he/she must consult the Council of State
Nuair a thagann an achainí os comhair an Uachtaráin ní mór dí/dó dul i gcomhairle leis an gComhairle Stáit

If the President decides that the Bill contains a proposal of such national importance that the will of the people should be found out, he/she will refuse to sign the Bill until a referendum has been held

Má dhéanann an tUachtarán cinneadh go bhfuil tábhacht mór náisiúnta ag baint leis an moladh sa bhille gur gá toil mhuintir na hÉireann a lorg diúltóidh sí/sé an bille a shíniú go dtí go mbeidh reifreann ar an gceist
The referendum must be held within 18 months of the President's decision not to sign the Bill
Ní mór go mbeadh reifreann ann taobh istigh de 18 mí ó dhéanann an tUachtarán cinneadh gan an bille a shíniú
This referendum gives the people of Ireland a chance to decide whether the Bill should become part of Irish law
Tugann an reifreann deis do phobal na hÉireann cinneadh a dhéanamh an ceart dlí a dhéanamh den bhille
The voting procedure at the ordinary referendum is the same as in a constitutional referendum, except that the proposal is deemed to have been vetoed by the people if:
Tá an córas vótála céanna i bhfeidhm do ghnáth reifreann agus a bhíonn do reifreann bunreachtúil , ach amháin go meastar go bhfuil diúltaithe ag an bpobal don mholadh má:
• The majority of the votes cast are against the Bill and
• Bhíonn tromlach na vótaí caite i gcoinne an Bhille agus
• Those votes make up at least one-third of the presidential electors on the register of electors
• Dhéanann na vótaí sin suas ar a laghad aon trian de na toghthóirí uachtaráin ar chlár na dtoghthóirí
